stories.title: Show HN: Cast AI raises $10M Series A and extends support to top cloud vendors
Dry Humor: Too Much Water Doesn't Damp Germans' Thrifty Habits (2014)

stories.text:
While some clients deserve it, many do not.

1. Stop using a contract as an opportunity to learn a new skill. You're going to take 3x longer to do the same work as someone with the skill.

Yes there is research and everyone checks StackOverflow and YouTube that's 100% ok. But ask yourselfâ€”would you bill the same hours to your client if they could see what you're doing with your time? Haha probably not.

2. The next dev who inherits your work will probably scrap it and start from scratch. They will disagree with how you built something, and will not or cannot "pick up where you left off."

3. Budget can be high or low, you see the same pattern. I've personally witnessed 7 projects abandoned and all were with different teams, scopes, complexity, and budget (6 figures on the high end, 3 on the low).
